original: du sems can phal pa rnams kyis nges pa'i ngo bos zhal la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyi sku mthong ba'o //
analyzed: du sems can phal pa rnams kyis nges pa'i ngo bos zhal la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyi sku mthong ba'o //
translated: Ordinary beings see the Bhagavān’s body as having a face and so on, due to its ascertained nature.

original: don dam pa'i rigs pas dpyad na /
analyzed: don dam pa'i rigs pas dpyad na /
translated: When analyzed with ultimate reasoning,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi sku la zhal la sogs pa med de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi sku la zhal la sogs pa med de /
translated: the Bhagavān’s body does not have a face and so on.

original: rgyu gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems can rnams kyi bsam pa'i dbang gis tha dad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi bsam pa'i dbang gis tha dad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because it is different due to the power of the thoughts of sentient beings.🔽Similarly,

original: de bzhin du /🔽kun nas phyag dang zhabs su ldan //
analyzed: de bzhin du / kun nas phyag dang zhabs su ldan //
translated: it is said:🔽He has hands and feet everywhere,

original: kun nas spyan dang dbu dang zhal //
analyzed: kun nas spyan dang dbu dang zhal //
translated: eyes, faces, and heads everywhere,

original: 'jig rten kun nas thos pa can //
analyzed: 'jig rten kun nas thos pa can //
translated: ears everywhere in the world,

original: thams cad khyab nas bzhugs pa'o //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thams cad khyab nas bzhugs pa'o // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: and he dwells pervading everything.

original: rgyu de dang de las gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu de dang de las gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is stated from that cause and that cause.

original: rgyu de'i phyir stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin dang / dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin mkhyen pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin dang / dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin mkhyen pa yin gyi /
translated: For that reason, he is the one who knows the nature of emptiness and compassion inseparable and the nature of all things,

original: nyi tshe ba dang bem po'i rang bzhin ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyi tshe ba dang bem po'i rang bzhin ni ma yin no //
translated: but he is not the one who has a limited or inanimate nature.

original: de bzhin du de'i gsung ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du de'i gsung ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: Likewise, what is his speech like?

original: gsung ni sems can mos pa'i dbang gis thos pa mchog tu gyur pa'o zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: gsung ni sems can mos pa'i dbang gis thos pa mchog tu gyur pa'o zhes bya ba ni //
translated: His speech is the supreme hearing, in accordance with the aspirations of sentient beings.

original: 'dir thog ma med pa'i 'khor ba nas 'khor nas sems can gyi bsam pa ni byed pa po dang bdag gir 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i grangs med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir thog ma med pa'i 'khor ba nas 'khor nas sems can gyi bsam pa ni byed pa po dang bdag gir 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i grangs med pa'o //
translated: Here, in beginningless cyclic existence, the aspirations of sentient beings are innumerable, such as the belief in an agent and an experiencer.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang de dang mthun par gang zag khur rdza khur ba bzhin du yod de gang rtag pa yang mi smra mi rtag pa yang mi smra zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang de dang mthun par gang zag khur rdza khur ba bzhin du yod de gang rtag pa yang mi smra mi rtag pa yang mi smra zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The Lord also, in accordance with that, said, “The person exists, like a load of merchandise. I do not say he is permanent, nor do I say he is impermanent.”

original: des kyang bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi mtshan nyid shes par byed pas na thos pa mchog tu gyur pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des kyang bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi mtshan nyid shes par byed pas na thos pa mchog tu gyur pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since that also causes the knowledge of the characteristics of unsurpassed enlightenment, it is called the supreme hearing.

original: de rgyu gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de rgyu gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of that?

original: rmi lam gyi gnas skabs su dngos po gang mthong ba de rnams yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin pa ji lta ba de bzhin du bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi gnas skabs su dngos po gang mthong ba de rnams yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin pa ji lta ba de bzhin du bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: Just as whatever things are seen in the dream state are neither existent nor nonexistent, so should the characteristic of unsurpassed enlightenment be understood.

original: gzhan yang gsung de ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gsung de ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: Moreover, how is that speech?

original: thams cad skad kyis zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: thams cad skad kyis zhes bya ba la /
translated: By all languages,

original: sems can thams cad kyi rang rang gi skad kyis bstan par mdzad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi rang rang gi skad kyis bstan par mdzad ces bya ba'o //
translated: it is taught by each and every language of all sentient beings.

original: ci bstan zhe na /
analyzed: ci bstan zhe na /
translated: What is taught?

original: dam pa'i lam zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dam pa'i lam zhes bya ba la /
translated: The excellent path,

original: dus thams cad du 'gyur ba med pa'i ngo bos gnas pa dang ; khyad par du gyur pas na dam pa yin la /
analyzed: dus thams cad du 'gyur ba med pa'i ngo bos gnas pa dang ; khyad par du gyur pas na dam pa yin la /
translated: it is excellent because it abides with an unchanging essence at all times and is distinguished.

original: 'dod pa'i dngos por phyin par byed pas na lam ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i dngos por phyin par byed pas na lam ste /
translated: It is a path because it causes one to arrive at the desired thing.

original: stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i dngos po ni dam pa'i lam zhes bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i dngos po ni dam pa'i lam zhes bya'o //
translated: The entity of inseparable emptiness and compassion is called the excellent path.

original: dus kun du de nyid bla na med pa'i byang chub thob pa'i phyir yang dag par bstan par mdzad kyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dus kun du de nyid bla na med pa'i byang chub thob pa'i phyir yang dag par bstan par mdzad kyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: He always teaches that in order to attain the unsurpassed enlightenment, and not for any other reason.

original: @169b mtshan nyid de lta bu dang ldan pa gang yin pa de la 'dud ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: @169b mtshan nyid de lta bu dang ldan pa gang yin pa de la 'dud ces bya ba'o //
translated: One who possesses such a nature is called “one who bows.”

original: sku bzhi las ma gtogs par yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang yang med de /
analyzed: sku bzhi las ma gtogs par yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang yang med de /
translated: There is no perfect buddha apart from the four bodies.

original: de bas na sku bzhi'i mtshan nyid ji lta bu yin zhe na /🔽rnam pa kun gyi mchog ldan pa'i /
analyzed: de bas na sku bzhi'i mtshan nyid ji lta bu yin zhe na / rnam pa kun gyi mchog ldan pa'i /
translated: Therefore, what is the nature of the four bodies?

original: sprul pa'i sku yi mtshan nyid de /🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku yi mtshan nyid de / zhes bya ba la /
translated: The emanation body has the nature of possessing the supreme of all aspects.🔽The nature of the emanation body is that it possesses the supreme of all aspects.

original: rnam pa kun zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam pa kun zhes bya ba ni /
translated: All aspects means

original: mgo bo la sogs pa'i yan lag rnams te /
analyzed: mgo bo la sogs pa'i yan lag rnams te /
translated: the major marks such as the head and so on.

original: 'jig rten pa'i rang bzhin las 'das pa dang / sgrib pa med pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pas na mchog yin la /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i rang bzhin las 'das pa dang / sgrib pa med pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pas na mchog yin la /
translated: It is supreme because it transcends the nature of the world and becomes the nature of the absence of obscurations.

original: yang pa rnam pa kun mchog ces bya ba ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: yang pa rnam pa kun mchog ces bya ba ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis la sogs pa ste /
translated: The supreme of all aspects means the thirty-two major marks of a great being and so on.

original: de rnams gang la yod pa de rnams pa kun gyi mchog dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams gang la yod pa de rnams pa kun gyi mchog dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Those who have those are endowed with the best of all aspects.

original: de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that?🔽The characteristic of the emanation body is that,

original: sprul pa'i sku'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis rmi lam bzhin du dngos po sna tshogs pa spro bar mdzad pas na /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis rmi lam bzhin du dngos po sna tshogs pa spro bar mdzad pas na /
translated: like a dream, it emanates various things under the power of the wishes of sentient beings.

original: sprul pa'i sku yin la de'i ngo bo de lta bu yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku yin la de'i ngo bo de lta bu yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it is the emanation body. The meaning is that it has that kind of nature.

original: de yang nyi tsheb dang dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin can ma yin nam zhe na /🔽sems can mos pa sna tshogs pas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de yang nyi tsheb dang dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin can ma yin nam zhe na / sems can mos pa sna tshogs pas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Moreover, is it not the case that it is limited and has the nature of all things?🔽Various wishes of sentient beings

original: sems can gyi mos pa ni chags pa dang chags pa dang bral ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi mos pa ni chags pa dang chags pa dang bral ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: means that the wishes of sentient beings are various, such as attachment and non-attachment.

original: bag chags de dang ldan pa'i sems kyis de bzhin du mthong ste /
analyzed: bag chags de dang ldan pa'i sems kyis de bzhin du mthong ste /
translated: The mind endowed with that habitual tendency sees it as such.

original: chags pa dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams kyis sna tshogs yum la sogs pa'i sku la 'khyud pa mdzad pa dang / dus thams cad du 'dod chags dang ldan pa dang / 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la spyod bar mdzad pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: chags pa dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams kyis sna tshogs yum la sogs pa'i sku la 'khyud pa mdzad pa dang / dus thams cad du 'dod chags dang ldan pa dang / 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la spyod bar mdzad pa mthong ngo //
translated: Sentient beings who are attached see him embracing the body of the Mother of the Multiverse, and so forth, and always being attached, he enjoys the five sense objects.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyis 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga las ldog par gyur pa dang / shin tu dka' thub mdzad par mthong ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyis 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga las ldog par gyur pa dang / shin tu dka' thub mdzad par mthong ste /
translated: Those who are free from attachment see him turning away from the five sense objects and practicing extreme asceticism.

original: de bas na 'dus ma byas pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i sprul pa'i sku ni mig gi spyod yul du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na 'dus ma byas pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i sprul pa'i sku ni mig gi spyod yul du gyur pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the emanation body, which has an unconditioned nature, is an object of the eye.

original: sku rdo rje zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sku rdo rje zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the phrase “the body vajra.”

original: 'o na gsung rdo rje'i bdag nyid du gyur pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gsung rdo rje'i bdag nyid du gyur pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: Now, what is the nature of the speech vajra?

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i mtshan nyid bshad par mdzad de /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i mtshan nyid bshad par mdzad de /
translated: The defining characteristics of the enjoyment body are explained.🔽By means of sound,

original: sems can thams cad sgra yis ni //🔽sems can bsam pa'i dbang gis su //
analyzed: sems can thams cad sgra yis ni //🔽sems can bsam pa'i dbang gis su //
translated: all sentient beings🔽are brought into the Buddha’s power.

original: gang zhig rdzu 'phrul bdag nyid ston //
analyzed: gang zhig rdzu 'phrul bdag nyid ston //
translated: The one who displays the nature of magical creation

original: longs spyod rdzogs sku'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs sku'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: is the characteristic of the Enjoyment Body.

original: zhes bya ba ni /🔽'gro ba drug la gnas par gyur pa'i sems can thams cad la rang rang gi skad kyis bsam pa dang mthun par chos @170a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni / 'gro ba drug la gnas par gyur pa'i sems can thams cad la rang rang gi skad kyis bsam pa dang mthun par chos @170a * //
translated: This is the characteristic of the Enjoyment Body.

original: kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong ni /
analyzed: kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong ni /
translated: The one who teaches the eighty-four thousand aggregates of the Dharma to all sentient beings in the six realms, in their respective languages, in accordance with their thoughts,🔽with the perfection of speech,

original: gsung gi phun sum tshogs pa gang gis bstan par mdzad pa de longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: gsung gi phun sum tshogs pa gang gis bstan par mdzad pa de longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
translated: is said to be the characteristic of the Enjoyment Body.

original: sgrib pa med pa'i sems kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa chos kyi sku'i mtshan nyid ji lta bu yin zhe na /🔽mi rtag ma yin rtag pa'ang min ;
analyzed: sgrib pa med pa'i sems kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa chos kyi sku'i mtshan nyid ji lta bu yin zhe na / mi rtag ma yin rtag pa'ang min ;
translated: What is the characteristic of the Dharma Body, which is the nature of the mind free from obscurations?

original: / zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: / zhes bya ba ni //
translated: It is not impermanent, nor is it permanent.

original: bcos pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i bum pa dang ka ba la sogs pa mi rtag pa'i bdag nyid ji lta ba de bzhin du gyur pas na /
analyzed: bcos pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i bum pa dang ka ba la sogs pa mi rtag pa'i bdag nyid ji lta ba de bzhin du gyur pas na /
translated: Since it is not like a pot, a pillar, etc., which have a fabricated nature and are impermanent,

original: mi rtag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa ma yin no //
translated: it is not impermanent.

original: 'o na gal te mi rtag pa med pa ma yin pa de lta na ni /
analyzed: 'o na gal te mi rtag pa med pa ma yin pa de lta na ni /
translated: But if impermanence is not non-existent,

original: rtag par mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: rtag par mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: then is it not permanent?

original: rtag pa'ang min zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rtag pa'ang min zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not permanent.

original: dus kun du nam mkha' bzhin du rtag pa'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: dus kun du nam mkha' bzhin du rtag pa'ang ma yin te /
translated: It is not permanent like space,

original: gal te dus thams cad du rtag pa'i rang bzhin yin pa de lta na ni /
analyzed: gal te dus thams cad du rtag pa'i rang bzhin yin pa de lta na ni /
translated: because if it were the nature of permanence at all times,

original: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: then it would not be perfect for the benefit of others,

original: chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong dang nam mkhar byon pa la sogs pa'i rdzu 'phrul ma bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong dang nam mkhar byon pa la sogs pa'i rdzu 'phrul ma bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would not display the miracles of the 84,000 aggregates of the Dharma, the journey to the sky, and so forth.

original: gzhan yang / gcig min du ma'i mtshan nyid min //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang / gcig min du ma'i mtshan nyid min // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Moreover, it is not one, nor does it have the characteristics of many.

original: gcig ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig ma yin te /
translated: It is not one,

original: rten tha dang par gyur pa'i dbang gis de yang tha dad par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten tha dang par gyur pa'i dbang gis de yang tha dad par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is different due to the power of the different supports.

original: de yang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: gzhan ni ngo bo sangs rgyas gcig gis chos kyi sku thob par gyur na /
analyzed: gzhan ni ngo bo sangs rgyas gcig gis chos kyi sku thob par gyur na /
translated: If another person obtains the dharmakāya,

original: phyi nas sangs rgyas gzhan gyis thob par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyi nas sangs rgyas gzhan gyis thob par mi 'gyur te /
translated: It is not obtained from another Buddha,

original: de las ma gtogs pa dngos po gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las ma gtogs pa dngos po gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no other entity apart from that.

original: 'o na du ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na du ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But is it not manifold?🔽It does not have the characteristic of manifoldness,

original: du ma'i mtshan nyid ma yin zhes bya ba ni thung ngu dang ring po dang bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid mang ba dang ldan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: du ma'i mtshan nyid ma yin zhes bya ba ni thung ngu dang ring po dang bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid mang ba dang ldan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: because it is not endowed with the manifold characteristics of long and short, pleasure and pain, etc.

original: dus thams cad du chos nyid 'ba' zhig pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus thams cad du chos nyid 'ba' zhig pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the nature of reality alone at all times.

original: gal te mtshan nyid mang ba dang ldan par 'gyur ba de lta na ni /
analyzed: gal te mtshan nyid mang ba dang ldan par 'gyur ba de lta na ni /
translated: If it were endowed with manifold characteristics,

original: mi rtag par 'gyur te bde ba dang sdug bsngal gnyis gcig tu mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtag par 'gyur te bde ba dang sdug bsngal gnyis gcig tu mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: it would be impermanent, because pleasure and pain would not be the same.

original: yang na chos kyi sku nyid ma yin pa de lta na ni /🔽sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bsdus pa dang sdom pa gcig tu mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na chos kyi sku nyid ma yin pa de lta na ni / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bsdus pa dang sdom pa gcig tu mi 'gyur te /
translated: Or else, it would not be the Dharma Body,

original: dngos po so sor gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po so sor gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would be a separate entity.🔽The Dharma Body is not a separate entity for each Buddha,🔽because the Buddhas are not separate.

original: gzhan yang / 'di ni dngos min dngos po min /
analyzed: gzhan yang / 'di ni dngos min dngos po min /
translated: It is not a thing, nor a non-thing.

original: zhes bya ba sa chu me rlung gi bdag nyid du gyur pa dngos po ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba sa chu me rlung gi bdag nyid du gyur pa dngos po ma yin te /
translated: It is not a thing, in the sense of being composed of earth, water, fire, and air,

original: ma bcos pa'i phyir nam mkha' las rang byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma bcos pa'i phyir nam mkha' las rang byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is unfabricated and self-arisen from space.

original: 'o na med pa'i dngos po min nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na med pa'i dngos po min nam zhe na /
translated: Well, is it not a non-thing?

original: dngos med min zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dngos med min zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not a non-thing.

original: rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa bzhin du @170b dngos po med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa bzhin du @170b dngos po med pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not a non-thing in every way, like a sky flower and so forth,

original: nyams su myong ba bdag nyid du gyur pa dang / rnam pa thams cad dang ldan par gyur pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yon tan kun skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba bdag nyid du gyur pa dang / rnam pa thams cad dang ldan par gyur pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yon tan kun skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the nature of experience and because it gives rise to all the qualities of a buddha endowed with every aspect.🔽Moreover,

original: gzhan yang rten dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang rten dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: it is free from a support,

original: rten dang brten pa'i 'brel pa dang bral ba dang / bskyed bya skyed byed kyi tshul las 'das par gyur pas te /
analyzed: rten dang brten pa'i 'brel pa dang bral ba dang / bskyed bya skyed byed kyi tshul las 'das par gyur pas te /
translated: because it is free from the connection of support and supported and because it transcends the mode of producer and produced.

original: dngos po thams cad las 'das par gyur pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa las skyes par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad las 'das par gyur pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa las skyes par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it transcends all entities and is born from non-conceptuality.

original: de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: chos kyi sku zhes bya ba ni chos nyid kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i dngos po ste /
analyzed: chos kyi sku zhes bya ba ni chos nyid kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i dngos po ste /
translated: The so-called dharmakāya is the entity that has the nature of reality.

original: 'khor ba'i bag chags dang bral bas na sems zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i bag chags dang bral bas na sems zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is called “mind” because it is free from the latent tendencies of saṃsāra.

original: 'o na sku gsum po bskyed pa po lhan cig skyes pa'i sku yin la /
analyzed: 'o na sku gsum po bskyed pa po lhan cig skyes pa'i sku yin la /

analyzed: de bas na de yang ji lta bu yin zhe na /

analyzed: stong nyid snying rje dbyer med pa // zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: dbyer med pa'i ngo bos gang la yod pa de stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'o //

original: gzhan yang / chags dang chags bral rnam spangs nyid /
analyzed: gzhan yang / chags dang chags bral rnam spangs nyid /
translated: Further, it is free from attachment and nonattachment.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: As such,

original: chags pa zhes bya ba ni lus kyi dga' ba la sogs pa bco lnga yin la /
analyzed: chags pa zhes bya ba ni lus kyi dga' ba la sogs pa bco lnga yin la /
translated: “attachment” is the fifteen aspects of physical bliss and so on.

original: chags bral zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chags bral zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “ Detachment” is

analyzed: mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: yang na shes rab 'ba' zhig pa'i rang bzhin yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang na shes rab 'ba' zhig pa'i rang bzhin yin zhe na /

original: gang zhig thabs min shes rab min //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang zhig thabs min shes rab min // zhes bya ba ni /

original: rang rig pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i thabs 'ba' zhig la yang yin te /
analyzed: rang rig pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i thabs 'ba' zhig la yang yin te /

original: stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i shes rab las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i shes rab las skyes pa'i phyir ro //

original: 'o na shes rab las skyes pa'i phyir shes rab yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na shes rab las skyes pa'i phyir shes rab yin nam zhe na /

original: shes rab min zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shes rab min zhes bya ba ni /

original: stong pa nyid 'ba' zhig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid 'ba' zhig pa ma yin te /

analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi gzugs ni mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the form of emptiness has the nature of the supreme unchanging.

original: de yang gang yin zhe na /🔽gzhan ni ngo bo @171a * //
analyzed: de yang gang yin zhe na / gzhan ni ngo bo @171a * //
translated: And what is that?

original: nyid kyi sku //
analyzed: nyid kyi sku //

analyzed: zhes bya ba la ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni rang gi sems kyi rang bzhin yin la /

analyzed: de nam gyi dus su 'khor ba'i bag chags dang bral bar gyur na /

analyzed: de'i dus su lhan cig skyes pa'i sku zhes bya'o // de bas na gzhan yin la snga ma bzhin ni ma yin te /

analyzed: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal dang bral ba'i phyir ro //

original: de las ma gtogs par gzhan ma ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de las ma gtogs par gzhan ma ni ma yin te /
translated: And it is not other than that,🔽because it is not separate from the previous one.

original: sems la rang bzhin nyid kyis gnas par gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems la rang bzhin nyid kyis gnas par gyur ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de bas na gzhan zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga'i bdag nyid yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the other is said to be the nature of both,

original: gnyi ga dang bral ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga dang bral ba ni ma yin no //

analyzed: de ltar brjod pa'i rim pas sku bzhi'i mtshan nyid so sor brjod par mdzad nas /

analyzed: sku bzhi po de rnams dang ldan par gyur pa gang yin pa de bstan par mdzad de /

analyzed: dus kyi 'khor lo zhes su brjod //

original: ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni /

analyzed: 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho'i rlabs kyis 'khrugs par mi nus pas na zhi ba zhes bya ste /

analyzed: yang na rnam par rtog pa thams cad nyams par gyur pas na zhi ba'o //

analyzed: sngon du brjod pa'i rim pas sku bzhi'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i dngos po ni /

original: de las phyin ci log tu gyur pa ni ma yin no //

translated: Now, the ten signs such as smoke are made consistent with the condition of sentient beings.

analyzed: 'dir sems can rnams la gal te 'dod chags kyi sems gdung bar gyur pa de lta na ni //

translated: Then, due to attachment to that, heat arises in the body, due to heat, thirst arises, and then, due to that, the desire for food and drink ceases.

original: sems la yul 'dod chags su gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems la yul 'dod chags su gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the mind is attached to objects.🔽Then, due to that, the body becomes emaciated, insane, without mindfulness, with a deluded mind, and extremely faint.

original: de nas de'i dbang gis lus po 'dra bar gyur pa dang / smyo ba dang / dran pa med pa dang / yid 'khrul par gyur pa dang / shin tu brgyal bar @186b gyur pa dang // gnas skabs bcu ni 'dod chags kyi dbang gis sems can rnams la skye ba ji lta ba de bzhin du rnam par mi rtog pa bsgom pa'i dbang gis rnal 'byor pa rnams la du ba la sogs pa'i rtags skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas de'i dbang gis lus po 'dra bar gyur pa dang / smyo ba dang / dran pa med pa dang / yid 'khrul par gyur pa dang / shin tu brgyal bar @186b gyur pa dang // gnas skabs bcu ni 'dod chags kyi dbang gis sems can rnams la skye ba ji lta ba de bzhin du rnam par mi rtog pa bsgom pa'i dbang gis rnal 'byor pa rnams la du ba la sogs pa'i rtags skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the ten states arise for sentient beings due to attachment, in the same way, for yogis, the signs such as smoke arise due to the power of cultivating non-conceptuality.

original: de nas bsam pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis 'dod chags de gsal por gyur pa ci lta ba de bzhin du du ba la sogs pa'i rtags rnams kyis rang gi sems kyi so sor snang ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i bcom ldan 'das rdo rje can gyi sprul
analyzed: de nas bsam pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis 'dod chags de gsal por gyur pa ci lta ba de bzhin du du ba la sogs pa'i rtags rnams kyis rang gi sems kyi so sor snang ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i bcom ldan 'das rdo rje can gyi sprul
translated: Then, by the power of the imagination and so on, that desire becomes clear, just like that, and by the signs of smoke and so on, the nature of the individual appearances of one’s mind is the emanation of the Bhagavān Vajrī.🔽

original: pa'i sku dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku rnal 'byor pas mthong ngo //
analyzed: pa'i sku dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku rnal 'byor pas mthong ngo //
translated: Then, by the power of thought and so on, that desire becomes clear, just as it is. In the same way, the yogin sees the emanation body of the Blessed One, Vajradhara, and the enjoyment body, which are of the nature of his own mind’s appearance, by means of the signs such as smoke and so on.

original: don dam par de la 'brel ba med de ;🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: 'dod pa'i lha dang bcom ldan 'das la 'brel ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no connection between the desired deity and the Blessed One.

original: de nyid bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par mdzad de /
translated: That is taught:🔽Desire, limbs arising in sequence, mouth opening, lotus drying, stopping eating,

original: bsam pa 'dod dang yan lag rim skyes kha mchog padma skams te bza' ba ldog pa dang // sdang dang smyo ba rmongs par gyur dang yid ni rnam par 'khrul dang drag tu brgyal ba ni //
analyzed: bsam pa 'dod dang yan lag rim skyes kha mchog padma skams te bza' ba ldog pa dang // sdang dang smyo ba rmongs par gyur dang yid ni rnam par 'khrul dang drag tu brgyal ba ni //
translated: hatred, insanity, confusion, mind deluded, and fainting violently.

original: rdo rje can gyi du ba la sogs bcu ste gsal yid srog chags rnams lus gnas skabs so //
analyzed: rdo rje can gyi du ba la sogs bcu ste gsal yid srog chags rnams lus gnas skabs so //
translated: The ten, beginning with smoke, of the one with the vajra, are the ten states of the body of the living beings.

original: 'jig rten dag tu yid gtsor byed kyi de rnams brjod de rgyal ba gang la 'dod pa de gang yin //
analyzed: 'jig rten dag tu yid gtsor byed kyi de rnams brjod de rgyal ba gang la 'dod pa de gang yin //
translated: In the world, the mind is primary, and those are described. What is it that the Victor wants?

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is said.

original: da ni phyi rol du drang ba'i don gyis zas za ba la sogs pa'i dam tshig gang yin pa de nges pa'i don gyis nang du bstan par mdzad de //🔽gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: da ni phyi rol du drang ba'i don gyis zas za ba la sogs pa'i dam tshig gang yin pa de nges pa'i don gyis nang du bstan par mdzad de // gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Now, he teaches the inner definitive meaning of whatever is the pledge of eating food, etc., by the outer interpretable meaning.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa la gtum mo 'bar ba'i dbang gis dpral bar byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le las shu kra'i rgyun 'dzag pa gang yin pa de bdag gi ma zhes bya ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga'🔽ba ster bar byed pa chang yin gyi //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa la gtum mo 'bar ba'i dbang gis dpral bar byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le las shu kra'i rgyun 'dzag pa gang yin pa de bdag gi ma zhes bya ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba ster bar byed pa chang yin gyi //
translated: Whatever is the stream of semen that falls from the drop of bodhicitta in the forehead by the power of the blazing fierce fire of the yogi who abides in the contemplation of the stage of completion, that is my mother, the innate joy🔽that bestows the bliss of the seminal essence.

original: myos par byed pa'i phyi rol gyi chang ni ma yin no //
analyzed: myos par byed pa'i phyi rol gyi chang ni ma yin no //
translated: It is the beer, not the external beer that intoxicates.

original: de bzhin du drang ba'i don gyis go ku la sogs pa'i stobs lnga gang yin pa de nges pa'i don gyis lha'i mig la sogs pas stong pa nyid kyi gzugs mthong ba la sogs pa yin gyi srog bcad pa las byung ba'i sha ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du drang ba'i don gyis go ku la sogs pa'i stobs lnga gang yin pa de nges pa'i don gyis lha'i mig la sogs pas stong pa nyid kyi gzugs mthong ba la sogs pa yin gyi srog bcad pa las byung ba'i sha ni ma yin no //
translated: Likewise, the five powers of beef, etc., which are of provisional meaning, are of definitive meaning as the divine eye, etc., which are the seeing of the form of emptiness, etc., and not as the meat that comes from killing living beings.

original: de bzhin du dri chen la sogs pa'i bdud rtsi lnga phyi rol du gang yin pa de nang du 'dzag pa med pa'i rang bzhin du gyur na rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i lha'i rang @187a * //🔽bzhin du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du dri chen la sogs pa'i bdud rtsi lnga phyi rol du gang yin pa de nang du 'dzag pa med pa'i rang bzhin du gyur na rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i lha'i rang @187a * // bzhin du 'gyur te /
translated: Likewise, the five nectars of feces, etc., which are external, are internal, having the nature of non-emission, and become the nature of the deities Vairochana, etc.

original: khyi la sogs pas za bar gyur pa'i mi gtsang ba ni ma yin no //🔽de bzhin du drang ba'i don gyis las kyi phyag rgya la gang brten pa ste /
analyzed: khyi la sogs pas za bar gyur pa'i mi gtsang ba ni ma yin no // de bzhin du drang ba'i don gyis las kyi phyag rgya la gang brten pa ste /
translated: They are not the impurities that are eaten by dogs, etc.

original: nges pa'i don gyis stong pa nyid kyi gzugs la sems 'jug pas /
analyzed: nges pa'i don gyis stong pa nyid kyi gzugs la sems 'jug pas /
translated: Likewise, the reliance on a karmamudra, which is of provisional meaning, is the entry of the mind into the form of emptiness, which is of definitive meaning.

original: ro mnyam pa nyid ni 'khrig pa yin gyi /
analyzed: ro mnyam pa nyid ni 'khrig pa yin gyi /
translated: The sameness of taste is sexual union,🔽and not the sexual union of the desire realm.

original: dbang po gnyis yang dag par sbyor ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po gnyis yang dag par sbyor ba ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the union of the two organs.

original: de bzhin du nor la sogs pa btang ba ni sbyin pa yin gyi sbyin pa'i bsam pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du nor la sogs pa btang ba ni sbyin pa yin gyi sbyin pa'i bsam pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Similarly, giving wealth, etc. is generosity, but not the intention to be generous.

original: de bzhin du gang drang ba'i don gyis tshul khrims kyi sdom pa de /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang drang ba'i don gyis tshul khrims kyi sdom pa de /
translated: Similarly, the vow of morality which is of provisional meaning

original: nges pa'i don gyis yid kyis 'pho ba dor ba ste /
analyzed: nges pa'i don gyis yid kyis 'pho ba dor ba ste /
translated: is the abandonment of the transference of the mind which is of definitive meaning.

original: sems ni mi 'pho ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems ni mi 'pho ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the mind becomes the nature of non-transference.

original: de bzhin du bud med rnams la rnam pa thams cad du reg par mi byed pa ni tshul khrims ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du bud med rnams la rnam pa thams cad du reg par mi byed pa ni tshul khrims ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, not touching women in any way is not morality,

original: las kyi phyag rgya'i sbyor ba las kyang tshangs par spyod pa ni tshul khrims yin te /
analyzed: las kyi phyag rgya'i sbyor ba las kyang tshangs par spyod pa ni tshul khrims yin te /
translated: but the practice of the karmamudra is morality.

original: byang chub kyi sems rnam pa thams cad du mi 'pho ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems rnam pa thams cad du mi 'pho ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the Thought of Enlightenment does not in any way transfer.

original: de bzhin du snyan pa dang mi snyan pa'i sgra la chags pa la sogs pa mi skye ba ni bzod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du snyan pa dang mi snyan pa'i sgra la chags pa la sogs pa mi skye ba ni bzod pa yin gyi /
translated: Similarly, the non-arising of attachment, etc. to pleasant and unpleasant sounds is patience,🔽but not the patience of accepting suffering.

original: rnyog pa med pa'i bzod pa ni bzod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnyog pa med pa'i bzod pa ni bzod pa ma yin no //
translated: Patience is not a patience that is not free from defilements.

original: de bzhin du g-yas pa dang / g-yon pa'i srog ni lam gnyis nyams par byed pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de bzhin du g-yas pa dang / g-yon pa'i srog ni lam gnyis nyams par byed pa'i phyir //
translated: In the same way, the life-force of the right and left channels is effort, because it causes the two paths to deteriorate.

original: rtsol ba byed pa gang yin pa de brtson 'grus yin gyi //
analyzed: rtsol ba byed pa gang yin pa de brtson 'grus yin gyi //
translated: That which is effort is effort,

original: dus thams cad du 'gron por 'khyams pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dus thams cad du 'gron por 'khyams pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but not wandering about as a guest at all times.

original: de bzhin mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba'i sems kyi bsgom pa ni bsam gtan yin gyi //
analyzed: de bzhin mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba'i sems kyi bsgom pa ni bsam gtan yin gyi //
translated: In the same way, the meditation of the mind that becomes the nature of supreme unchanging bliss is concentration,

original: sdug bsngal ster bar byed pa rtog pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ster bar byed pa rtog pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the nature of conceptual thought that bestows suffering.

original: de bzhin du dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin shes pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi skad kyis chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong ston par shes pa ni shes rab yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin shes pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi skad kyis chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong ston par shes pa ni shes rab yin gyi /
translated: In the same way, the knowledge of the nature of all things and the knowledge of teaching the 84,000 dharma aggregates with the languages of all sentient beings is wisdom,

original: 'jig rten pa'i bya ba shes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i bya ba shes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the knowledge of worldly activities.

original: de ltar drang ba'i don dang nges pa'i don gyis don 'di lta bur gyur pa'i rnal 'byor pa gang gis shes pa de la rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa dang srid pa nyams pa dang mi skye ba nyid thob par 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar drang ba'i don dang nges pa'i don gyis don 'di lta bur gyur pa'i rnal 'byor pa gang gis shes pa de la rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa dang srid pa nyams pa dang mi skye ba nyid thob par 'gyur pa'o //
translated: Thus, the yogin who knows this sort of meaning of the provisional and definitive meanings will attain the perfection of his own aim, the decline of existence, and the attainment of non-arising.

original: de ltar kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pas lam bstan par mdzad nas /
analyzed: de ltar kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pas lam bstan par mdzad nas /
translated: Having thus taught the path by means of the conventional and ultimate truths,

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa 'ba' @187b zhig pa'i lam bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa 'ba' @187b zhig pa'i lam bstan par mdzad de /
translated: he teaches the path of the creation stage alone.

original: yan lag gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: yan lag gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: With one branch, and so on.

original: 'dir rnal 'byor bas 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir rnal 'byor bas 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, in order to accomplish mundane powers,

original: sngon du brjod pa'i cho gas bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo dpa' bo gcig pu'am shes rab dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: sngon du brjod pa'i cho gas bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo dpa' bo gcig pu'am shes rab dang ldan pa'am /
translated: the yogin, by means of the previously described ritual, should visualize the Bhagavān Kālacakra as a single hero, or with wisdom,

original: 'khor dang bcas pa rnam pa dgu'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'am /
analyzed: 'khor dang bcas pa rnam pa dgu'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'am /
translated: or with a retinue, in the form of the nine deities.

original: rnam pa nyi shu rtsa lnga'i bdag nyid du gyur pa dang / yang na bcom ldan 'das sna tshogs yum de bzhin du bsgoms la /
analyzed: rnam pa nyi shu rtsa lnga'i bdag nyid du gyur pa dang / yang na bcom ldan 'das sna tshogs yum de bzhin du bsgoms la /
translated: Or else, the practitioner should visualize the Blessed One as Viśvamātā.

original: de nas rnal 'byor pas zhi ba la sogs pa'i las thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas rnal 'byor pas zhi ba la sogs pa'i las thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, the practitioner will accomplish all activities such as pacification and so forth.

original: da ni nam mkha' lding gi tshigs su bcad pa rnams ni bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni nam mkha' lding gi tshigs su bcad pa rnams ni bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the verses of Garuḍa should be explained.

original: srog ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dir sbrul gyis zos sam /
analyzed: srog ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dir sbrul gyis zos sam /
translated: Here, in “endowed with life,” and so forth, one who is not alive due to being eaten by a snake,

original: yang na dug zos pas mi 'tsho ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na dug zos pas mi 'tsho ba'i phyir /
translated: or else due to having eaten poison,

original: rnal 'byor pa'i rtsar lho phyogs nas gal te pho nya gnyis 'ongs par gyur pa de lta na ni nad pa 'chi bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa'i rtsar lho phyogs nas gal te pho nya gnyis 'ongs par gyur pa de lta na ni nad pa 'chi bar 'gyur te /
translated: if two messengers come from the south to the nāḍī of the practitioner, then the patient will die.

original: de bas na rnal 'byor pas de la thabs bka' stsal bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na rnal 'byor pas de la thabs bka' stsal bar mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the practitioner should not give advice to him.

original: de bzhin du pho nyas zhus pa'i dus su mi mnyam pa'i yi ge brjod na nad pa 'tsho bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du pho nyas zhus pa'i dus su mi mnyam pa'i yi ge brjod na nad pa 'tsho bar 'gyur te /
translated: Likewise, if the messenger utters an uneven syllable at the time of the inquiry, the patient will live.

original: de nas mnyam pa'i yi ge brjod na nad pa 'chi bar 'gyur bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas mnyam pa'i yi ge brjod na nad pa 'chi bar 'gyur bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Then, if the equal syllables are uttered, one should know that the patient will die.

original: de bzhin du gal te pho nyas sbrul la sogs pa'i ming sngon du brjod na 'chi bar byed pa de lta na ni sbrul gyis zos pa 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te pho nyas sbrul la sogs pa'i ming sngon du brjod na 'chi bar byed pa de lta na ni sbrul gyis zos pa 'chi ba'o //
translated: Similarly, if the messenger utters the name of a snake, etc., in advance, one should know that the patient will die.

original: de ltar phyi'i rtags shes nas nang gi rtags kyang shes par byas te zhu ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de ltar phyi'i rtags shes nas nang gi rtags kyang shes par byas te zhu ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Thus, having understood the external signs, one should also understand the internal signs.

original: 'dir dbugs 'jug pa'i dus su gal te zhu bar gyur pa de lta na ni /
analyzed: 'dir dbugs 'jug pa'i dus su gal te zhu bar gyur pa de lta na ni /
translated: Here, if the patient's breath becomes weak at the time of inhalation,

original: nad pa la dge bar gyur par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: nad pa la dge bar gyur par shes par bya'o //
translated: one should know that it is auspicious for the patient.

original: de nas phar dbyung ba'i dus su zhu bar byas na /
analyzed: de nas phar dbyung ba'i dus su zhu bar byas na /
translated: Then, if the breath becomes weak at the time of exhalation,

original: mi 'tsho ba'i rtags su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mi 'tsho ba'i rtags su shes par bya'o //
translated: one should know it as a sign of non-survival.

original: de bzhin du pho nyas rkang pa g-yon pa mdun du bzhag nas zhu bar byed na /
analyzed: de bzhin du pho nyas rkang pa g-yon pa mdun du bzhag nas zhu bar byed na /
translated: Similarly, if the messenger places the left foot forward and breathes,

original: rtags des bud med sbrul gyis zos pa rjod par byed de /
analyzed: rtags des bud med sbrul gyis zos pa rjod par byed de /
translated: that sign indicates that a woman has been bitten by a snake.

original: de nas g-yas mdun du bzhag nas zhu bar byed na /
analyzed: de nas g-yas mdun du bzhag nas zhu bar byed na /
translated: Then, if the right foot is placed forward and one breathes,

original: des ni skyes pa zos pa bstan par byed ces bya'o //
analyzed: des ni skyes pa zos pa bstan par byed ces bya'o //
translated: This is said to be the indication of the consumption of the semen.

original: de ltar rnal 'byor pas mtshan ma bzang por gyur par shes nas nad pa'i rtsar 'gro bar byas la /
analyzed: de ltar rnal 'byor pas mtshan ma bzang por gyur par shes nas nad pa'i rtsar 'gro bar byas la /
translated: Thus, the yogī, having understood the good signs, should go to the patient.

original: nad pa'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: nad pa'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: The characteristics of the patient should be known.

original: de la gal te nad pa'i mig dang gdong pa shin tu rgyas @188a * //
analyzed: de la gal te nad pa'i mig dang gdong pa shin tu rgyas @188a * //
translated: If the eyes and face of the patient are very swollen,

original: par gyur pa dang / rna ba'i rtsa nag por gyur pa de lta na ni sems can de 'chi bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: par gyur pa dang / rna ba'i rtsa nag por gyur pa de lta na ni sems can de 'chi bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: and the ear-channel is black, then that sentient being will die.

original: de la yang snying gar gal te sgra cung zad yod pa de lta na ni rnal 'byor pas thabs bka' stsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la yang snying gar gal te sgra cung zad yod pa de lta na ni rnal 'byor pas thabs bka' stsal bar bya'o //
translated: If there is a little sound at the heart, then the yogī should apply the method.

original: de nyid bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par mdzad de /
translated: That itself is taught:

original: dang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: First, etc.

original: 'dir rnal 'byor pas dang por bdag bsrung ba'i cho gas rang la bsrung bar bya la /
analyzed: 'dir rnal 'byor pas dang por bdag bsrung ba'i cho gas rang la bsrung bar bya la /
translated: Here, the yogī should first protect himself with the rite of self-protection.

original: de nas bdag dang nad pa'i srung ba 'khor lo drug la de bzhin gshegs pa rigs drug gi sa bon dgod par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas bdag dang nad pa'i srung ba 'khor lo drug la de bzhin gshegs pa rigs drug gi sa bon dgod par bya ste /
translated: Then, for the protection of himself and the patient, he should place the seed syllables of the six tathāgatas in the six cakras.

original: de nas rang gi lag pa'i sor mo lnga ni mthe bong la sogs pa'i rim pas sa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du bsgoms la /
analyzed: de nas rang gi lag pa'i sor mo lnga ni mthe bong la sogs pa'i rim pas sa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du bsgoms la /
translated: Then, one should meditate on the five fingers of one's hand, beginning with the thumb, as having the nature of earth, etc.

original: sor mo de rnams la sa la sogs pa'i sa bon rnams dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: sor mo de rnams la sa la sogs pa'i sa bon rnams dgod par bya'o //
translated: One should place the seed syllables of earth, etc., on those fingers.

original: de bzhin du nad pa'i brla'i tshigs dang gsus pa dang snying ga dang dpral bar ha ya ra wa la ni rim pa bzhin du dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du nad pa'i brla'i tshigs dang gsus pa dang snying ga dang dpral bar ha ya ra wa la ni rim pa bzhin du dgod par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should place ha, ya, ra, va, and la, respectively, on the knee, hip, navel, heart, and forehead of the patient.

original: de bzhin du ham ksham h'a ya y'a ra r'a wa w'a la l'a zhes bya ba ni mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa'i sa bon rnams ni dgod par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du ham ksham h'a ya y'a ra r'a wa w'a la l'a zhes bya ba ni mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa'i sa bon rnams ni dgod par bya ste /
translated: In the same way, one should place haṃ, kṣaṃ, ha, ya, rā, vā, va, la, lā, the seed syllables of the even and uneven parts.

original: de la g-yon phyogs kyi brla la sogs pa'i yan lag rnams la hya la sogs pa'i yi ge lnga thung du dgod par bya zhing /
analyzed: de la g-yon phyogs kyi brla la sogs pa'i yan lag rnams la hya la sogs pa'i yi ge lnga thung du dgod par bya zhing /
translated: There, one should place the five short syllables, hya, etc., on the left leg, etc.,

original: g-yas pa'i yan lag rnams la ni ring po rnams so //
analyzed: g-yas pa'i yan lag rnams la ni ring po rnams so //
translated: and the long ones on the right limbs.

original: de ltar nad pa la srung ba byas nas rang gi lag pa'i mthil la yi ge h'um kshum bkod nas nad pa'i snying ga'i gnas su bzhag pas nad pa'i dug ni g-yo bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar nad pa la srung ba byas nas rang gi lag pa'i mthil la yi ge h'um kshum bkod nas nad pa'i snying ga'i gnas su bzhag pas nad pa'i dug ni g-yo bar gyur pa'o //
translated: Having thus protected the patient, one should place the syllable hūṃ kṣūṃ on the palm of one’s hand and place it on the heart of the patient. The poison of the patient will move.

original: yang na dpral bar yi ge la dang rkang pa la yi ge ha bsgoms na dug 'chad par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na dpral bar yi ge la dang rkang pa la yi ge ha bsgoms na dug 'chad par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Alternatively, if one visualizes the syllable la on the forehead and the syllable ha on the feet, the poison will be eliminated.

original: de ltar spyi bor yi ge wa dang gsus pa la yi ge ra bsgoms na dug med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar spyi bor yi ge wa dang gsus pa la yi ge ra bsgoms na dug med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, if one visualizes the syllable va on the head and the syllable ra on the belly, the poison will disappear.

original: dpral bar yi ge ya dang rkang pa la yi ger bsgoms na dug 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dpral bar yi ge ya dang rkang pa la yi ger bsgoms na dug 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one visualizes the syllable ya on the forehead and the syllable ra on the feet, the poison will spread.

original: mgo bo la yi ge ha dang rkang pa la yi ge la bsgoms na dug 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mgo bo la yi ge ha dang rkang pa la yi ge la bsgoms na dug 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one visualizes the syllable ha on the head and the syllable la on the feet, the poison will be eliminated.

original: de bzhin du dpral bar thig le dkar po bsgoms na brtan pa dang g-yo ba dang bcas pa'i dug ni med par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dpral bar thig le dkar po bsgoms na brtan pa dang g-yo ba dang bcas pa'i dug ni med par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Similarly, if one visualizes a white drop on the forehead, the poison of all moving and unmoving beings will disappear.

original: de bzhin du me'i sa bon dmar pos dug g-yo bar byed pa dang / rlung gi sa bon nag pos dug 'jug par 'gyur ba dang / sa'i sa bon ser pos mi g-yo bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du me'i sa bon dmar pos dug g-yo bar byed pa dang / rlung gi sa bon nag pos dug 'jug par 'gyur ba dang / sa'i sa bon ser pos mi g-yo bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Likewise, the red seed of fire causes the poison to move, the black seed of wind causes the poison to spread, and the yellow seed of earth causes the poison to become immobile.

original: de nas gal te rnal 'byor pas ting nge 'dzin @188b gyi stobs kyis 'tsho bar mi nus pa de lta na ni /
analyzed: de nas gal te rnal 'byor pas ting nge 'dzin @188b gyi stobs kyis 'tsho bar mi nus pa de lta na ni /
translated: Then, if the yogi is unable to live by the power of samādhi,

original: sman gyi sbyor ba byas te /
analyzed: sman gyi sbyor ba byas te /
translated: he should prepare a medicinal compound.

original: de la li do ra dang pi pi ling dang / na le sham cha mnyam par byas te mi bskyod pas btags par bya /
analyzed: de la li do ra dang pi pi ling dang / na le sham cha mnyam par byas te mi bskyod pas btags par bya /
translated: For that, he should make equal parts of long pepper, white pepper, and nut grass, and grind them with Akṣobhya.

original: de nas sdong bu'i dbyibs lta bu byas nas srog 'bab par gyur pa'i lam la bcug na dug med par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de nas sdong bu'i dbyibs lta bu byas nas srog 'bab par gyur pa'i lam la bcug na dug med par 'gyur ro ;
translated: Then, having made it into the shape of a stick, if he inserts it into the path of the descending life-force, the poison will be eliminated.

original: / de bzhin du lce'u chung la sor mos cha la bzhag pa de bzhin du dug med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / de bzhin du lce'u chung la sor mos cha la bzhag pa de bzhin du dug med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, by placing the fingers on the drum, the poison will be eliminated.

original: yang na rdo rje mda' dang dz'a ti dang gzhon nu ma dang / tsha ba gsum dang lan tshva dang lang ga li dang dhi ba da'i tshangs pa mo dang / ksha datta'i dri dang nyin phyed ma dang / ban dha kar ku dang ki dang /
analyzed: yang na rdo rje mda' dang dz'a ti dang gzhon nu ma dang / tsha ba gsum dang lan tshva dang lang ga li dang dhi ba da'i tshangs pa mo dang / ksha datta'i dri dang nyin phyed ma dang / ban dha kar ku dang ki dang /
translated: the scent of kshadatta, midday, bandhakar, ki,

original: dri chen dang dri chu dang / sha dang khrag ni mnyam por byas nas mi bskyod pas btags pa'i ri lu byas nas lam gang nas srog 'bab par gyur pa de la bcug na 'byung po dang 'byung po'i rims dang dug gzhom par ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dri chen dang dri chu dang / sha dang khrag ni mnyam por byas nas mi bskyod pas btags pa'i ri lu byas nas lam gang nas srog 'bab par gyur pa de la bcug na 'byung po dang 'byung po'i rims dang dug gzhom par ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: excrement, urine, flesh, and blood, having made them equal, one should make a pill sealed with Akshobhya. If one inserts it into the path through which the life force flows, one will conquer bhutas, bhuti fever, and poison.

original: de ni dug drag po'i mtshan nyid brjod par mdzad de /
analyzed: de ni dug drag po'i mtshan nyid brjod par mdzad de /
translated: This is said to be the characteristic of strong poison.

original: nyi ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: nyi ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The sun and so on are as follows.

original: 'dir nyi ma la sogs pa'i gza' bdun ni nyin mtshan re re la lhag pa'i lha yin te //
analyzed: 'dir nyi ma la sogs pa'i gza' bdun ni nyin mtshan re re la lhag pa'i lha yin te //
translated: Here, the seven planets beginning with the sun are the additional deities for each day and night.

original: de rnams kyi mthar brgyad pa ni sgra gcan yin la de nyid stong par brjod de /
analyzed: de rnams kyi mthar brgyad pa ni sgra gcan yin la de nyid stong par brjod de /
translated: At the end of those, the eighth is Rahu, and that is called empty.

original: gza' bdun gyis dor bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gza' bdun gyis dor bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is abandoned by the seven planets.

original: de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: rigs ldan ni gzugs phyed kyi rtsa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rigs ldan ni gzugs phyed kyi rtsa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The one with the zodiac sign is called the half-form nāḍī.

original: chu tshod phyed kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i rigs ldan ma yin te /
analyzed: chu tshod phyed kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i rigs ldan ma yin te /
translated: It is not the one with the zodiac sign that has the nature of half a watch.

original: de yang 'chi ba ster bar byed par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang 'chi ba ster bar byed par shes par bya'o //
translated: And that should be known as the giver of death.

original: de bas na de'i dus su dug za ba la sogs pa ni mi bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na de'i dus su dug za ba la sogs pa ni mi bya ste /
translated: Therefore, at that time, one should not eat poison, and so on.

original: gal te dug la sogs pa bza' bar byed pa de lta na ni /
analyzed: gal te dug la sogs pa bza' bar byed pa de lta na ni /
translated: If one eats poison, and so on,

original: dus de'i dbang gis nges par 'chi bar 'gyur bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dus de'i dbang gis nges par 'chi bar 'gyur bar shes par bya'o //
translated: one should understand that one will definitely die by the power of that time.

original: de nyid bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par mdzad de /
translated: That is taught:

original: klu la rtse bar mi bya rnam gsum dug kyang der ni bza' mi bya'o //
analyzed: klu la rtse bar mi bya rnam gsum dug kyang der ni bza' mi bya'o //
translated: One should not play with the nāgas, and one should not eat the three poisons there.

original: de nyid la ni sbrul gyis sos bzung gshin rje'i gnas 'gro 'byung pos bzung ngam mtshon gyis phug na yang //
analyzed: de nyid la ni sbrul gyis sos bzung gshin rje'i gnas 'gro 'byung pos bzung ngam mtshon gyis phug na yang //
translated: If one is bitten by a snake there, or if one is seized by a bhūta, or if one is pierced by a weapon,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: one will go to the realm of the Lord of Death.

original: rigs ldan ma de lta bu gang yin pa de nam gyi dus su shar bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rigs ldan ma de lta bu gang yin pa de nam gyi dus su shar bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: At what time does that one with the zodiac sign rise?

original: nyi ma phyed ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: nyi ma phyed ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: At noon, etc.

original: 'dir nyin mtshan re re nyi ma phyed kyi mtshams dang / nyi ma nub pa'i mtshams dang / mtshan mo phyed kyi mtshams dang / nam langs pa dang nyi ma shar ba'i mtshams su nyi ma la @189a * //
analyzed: 'dir nyin mtshan re re nyi ma phyed kyi mtshams dang / nyi ma nub pa'i mtshams dang / mtshan mo phyed kyi mtshams dang / nam langs pa dang nyi ma shar ba'i mtshams su nyi ma la @189a * //
translated: Here, at the end of each day and night, at noon, at sunset, at midnight, at dawn, and at sunrise, the sun, etc.,

original: sogs pa'i gza' rab tu dbye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sogs pa'i gza' rab tu dbye ba'i phyir /
translated: are distinguished by the planets.

original: stong pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i dus kyis zos pa'i rtsa gcig ni rigs ldan ma yin te /
analyzed: stong pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i dus kyis zos pa'i rtsa gcig ni rigs ldan ma yin te /
translated: One nāḍī is consumed by the empty nature of time, which is not a planet.

original: rigs ldan ma'i dug gang yin pa de rnams sgra gcan gyi gdong par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs ldan ma'i dug gang yin pa de rnams sgra gcan gyi gdong par shes par bya'o //
translated: Whatever is the poison of the planet, one should know that to be Rāhu’s face.

original: de nyid bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par mdzad de /
translated: That is taught:

original: 'di ni sgra gcan gdong pa yin te nyin dang nyin gyi dus su yang dag rig par bya //
analyzed: 'di ni sgra gcan gdong pa yin te nyin dang nyin gyi dus su yang dag rig par bya //
translated: This is Rāhu’s face, which should be known at the time of each day.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That is said.

original: da ni klu mtha' yas la sogs pa'i nyin mtshan re re'i longs spyod rjod par byed de /
analyzed: da ni klu mtha' yas la sogs pa'i nyin mtshan re re'i longs spyod rjod par byed de /
translated: Now, the enjoyment of the nāgas, beginning with Ananta, is described in each day and night.

original: nyi ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: nyi ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The sun, etc.

original: 'dir nyin mtshan gang la gza' nyi mar gyur pa'i nyin mtshan de la klu mtha' yas kyis byin gyis rlob par byed de /
analyzed: 'dir nyin mtshan gang la gza' nyi mar gyur pa'i nyin mtshan de la klu mtha' yas kyis byin gyis rlob par byed de /
translated: Here, the nāga Ananta blesses the day and night when the day and night become Sunday.

original: phyi nas klu'i rgyal po gzhan rnams kyis byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyi nas klu'i rgyal po gzhan rnams kyis byed par 'gyur te /
translated: Later, the other nāga kings do so.

original: gza' bdun gyi dbye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gza' bdun gyi dbye ba'i phyir /
translated: For the division of the seven planets,

original: gza' nyi ma'i dus su zla ba la sogs pa yang shar bar gyur pa ji lta ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: gza' nyi ma'i dus su zla ba la sogs pa yang shar bar gyur pa ji lta ba de bzhin du /
translated: just as the moon and so on rise at the time of Sunday,

original: klu gcig gis nyin mtshan la klu gzhan rnams 'byung bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: klu gcig gis nyin mtshan la klu gzhan rnams 'byung bar shes par bya'o //
translated: so one should understand that the other nāgas arise during the day and night of a single nāga.

original: spyir de rnams kyi chu tshod du tsam gyi bar du dus longs spyod yin zhe na /
analyzed: spyir de rnams kyi chu tshod du tsam gyi bar du dus longs spyod yin zhe na /
translated: In general, for how many hours do they enjoy the day?

original: mkha' dus zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mkha' dus zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In the sky, time, and so on,

original: 'dir blu mtha' yas la sogs pa rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du gza' nyi ma la sogs pa'i dus su chu tshod drug cu dang dgu bcu dang lnga bcu dang / bzhi bcu dang / brgyad cu dang bdun cu dang chu tshod sum cu dang /
analyzed: 'dir blu mtha' yas la sogs pa rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du gza' nyi ma la sogs pa'i dus su chu tshod drug cu dang dgu bcu dang lnga bcu dang / bzhi bcu dang / brgyad cu dang bdun cu dang chu tshod sum cu dang /
translated: here, Ananta and so on enjoy the day for sixty, ninety, fifty, forty, eighty, seventy, and thirty hours, respectively, in the time of Sunday and so on.

original: chu tshod drug cu ni longs spyod du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: chu tshod drug cu ni longs spyod du gyur pa'o //
translated: The sixty hours are the enjoyment.

original: longs spyod de'i dbang gis dug gi mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: longs spyod de'i dbang gis dug gi mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: The characteristics of the poison should be understood by the power of that enjoyment.

original: brgyad po de rnams kyi rigs dang kha dog ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: brgyad po de rnams kyi rigs dang kha dog ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What are the types and colors of those eight?

original: bram ze zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bram ze zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The Brahmins, etc.

original: 'dir klu mtha' yas dang rigs ldan ni bram ze'i rigs yin te /
analyzed: 'dir klu mtha' yas dang rigs ldan ni bram ze'i rigs yin te /
translated: Here, the nagas Ananta and Kulika are of the Brahmin caste.

original: rigs de'i dbang gis de dag gi kha dog dkar por shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs de'i dbang gis de dag gi kha dog dkar por shes par bya'o //
translated: By the power of that caste, their color should be understood as white.

original: bde bzhin du nor rgyas kyi bu dang dung skyong gi kha dog dmar po dang / rgyal rigs su 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bde bzhin du nor rgyas kyi bu dang dung skyong gi kha dog dmar po dang / rgyal rigs su 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Similarly, the colors of Vāsuki and Takṣaka are red and they are of the Kshatriya caste.

original: padma chen po dang / 'jog po'i kha dog ser po dang rje'u rigs so //
analyzed: padma chen po dang / 'jog po'i kha dog ser po dang rje'u rigs so //
translated: The colors of Mahapadma and Karkota are yellow and they are of the Vaishya caste.

original: stobs kyi rgyu dang padma ni dmangs rigs dang kha dog nag po'o //
analyzed: stobs kyi rgyu dang padma ni dmangs rigs dang kha dog nag po'o //
translated: The colors of Anavatapta and Padma are black and they are of the Shudra caste.

original: rgyal ba dang rnam par rgyal ba ni tha ma'i rigs dang kha dog sna tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal ba dang rnam par rgyal ba ni tha ma'i rigs dang kha dog sna tshogs pa'o //
translated: The colors of Jaya and Vijaya are various and they are of the lowest caste.

original: de rnams kyi skye gnas gnag yin zhe na /
analyzed: de rnams kyi skye gnas gnag yin zhe na /
translated: What are their birthplaces?

original: skye gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa @189b la 'dir bram ze'i rigs su gyur pa'i klu rnams kyi skye gnas ni chu'o //
analyzed: skye gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa @189b la 'dir bram ze'i rigs su gyur pa'i klu rnams kyi skye gnas ni chu'o //
translated: The “birthplaces” and so on are as follows: here, the birthplaces of the nāgas of the brahmin caste are water.

original: rgyal rigs kyi klu rnams kyi me'o //🔽rje'u rigs klu rigs gnyis kyi sa'o //
analyzed: rgyal rigs kyi klu rnams kyi me'o // rje'u rigs klu rigs gnyis kyi sa'o //
translated: The nāgas of the kṣatriya caste are fire.🔽The nāgas of the vaiśya caste are earth.

original: dmangs rigs kyi klu gnyis kyi rlung ngo //
analyzed: dmangs rigs kyi klu gnyis kyi rlung ngo //
translated: The nāgas of the śūdra caste are wind.

original: rgyal ba'i skye gnas ni nam mkha'o //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i skye gnas ni nam mkha'o //
translated: The birthplaces of the victorious ones are space.

original: klu rnam par rgyal ba'i skye gnas ni ye shes kyi khams su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: klu rnam par rgyal ba'i skye gnas ni ye shes kyi khams su shes par bya'o //
translated: The birthplaces of the victorious nāgas should be known as the element of gnosis.

original: de bas na chu la sogs pa'i sa bon thung du dang ring po yongs su gyur pa las de rnams skye bar gyur pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na chu la sogs pa'i sa bon thung du dang ring po yongs su gyur pa las de rnams skye bar gyur pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the arising of those from the transformation of short and long seeds such as water is certain.

original: da ni nam mkha' lding gi mtshan nyid bshad de /
analyzed: da ni nam mkha' lding gi mtshan nyid bshad de /
translated: Now, the characteristics of Garuḍa are explained.

original: rkang pa nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rkang pa nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: From the feet and so on,

original: 'dir nam mkha' lding bsgrub par 'dod pa'i rnal 'byor pas rang gi snying ga'i padma'i nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor steng du yi ge ksham bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir nam mkha' lding bsgrub par 'dod pa'i rnal 'byor pas rang gi snying ga'i padma'i nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor steng du yi ge ksham bsgom par bya ste /
translated: here, a yogin who wishes to accomplish Garuḍa should meditate on the syllable kṣaṃ on the sun maṇḍala in the heart lotus.

original: de yongs su gyur pa las nam mkha' lding skye bar bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las nam mkha' lding skye bar bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine that it is transformed into Garuḍa.

original: de yang ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What is he like?

original: rkang pa nas rked pa'i bar du kha dog ser po ste /
analyzed: rkang pa nas rked pa'i bar du kha dog ser po ste /
translated: From the feet up to the waist, he is yellow.

original: de nas lte ba'i bar du dkar po'o //
analyzed: de nas lte ba'i bar du dkar po'o //
translated: From there up to the navel, he is white.

original: lte ba nas mgrin pa'i bar du dmar po'o //
analyzed: lte ba nas mgrin pa'i bar du dmar po'o //
translated: From the navel up to the throat, he is red.

original: mgrin pa nas smin ma'i bar du nag po'o //
analyzed: mgrin pa nas smin ma'i bar du nag po'o //
translated: From the throat up to the eyebrows, he is black.

original: de nas mgo bo ma lus pa ni sna tshogs pa dang klu'i rgyal po rnams kyis brgyan par gyur pa dang / lus po las kha dog lnga dang ldan par gyur pa'i 'od zer spro bar bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas mgo bo ma lus pa ni sna tshogs pa dang klu'i rgyal po rnams kyis brgyan par gyur pa dang / lus po las kha dog lnga dang ldan par gyur pa'i 'od zer spro bar bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Then, the entire head is variegated and adorned with the nāga kings, and one should imagine that light rays of five colors radiate from the body.

original: de nas de'i lus po la gtsug tor la sogs pa'i 'khor lo lnga la nam mkha' la sogs pa'i yi ge lnga bkod nas de'i sngags bye ba phrag gcig bzlas par bya zhing /
analyzed: de nas de'i lus po la gtsug tor la sogs pa'i 'khor lo lnga la nam mkha' la sogs pa'i yi ge lnga bkod nas de'i sngags bye ba phrag gcig bzlas par bya zhing /
translated: Then, having arranged the five syllables such as ḍa on the five cakras such as the uṣṇīṣa on his body, one should recite his mantra ten million times.

original: 'bum phrag bcu ni sbyin sreg tu bya'o //
analyzed: 'bum phrag bcu ni sbyin sreg tu bya'o //
translated: One should perform the burnt offerings one hundred thousand times.

original: de'i sngags ni /
analyzed: de'i sngags ni /
translated: His mantra is:

original: aom pakshe sv'a h'a /🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: aom pakshe sv'a h'a /🔽zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Oṃ pakṣe svāhā.

original: de nas sngags de dang de'i phyag rgyas 'byung po la sogs pas bzung ba dang dug zos pa'i mi gang la rnal 'byor pas reg par byed pa de'i skad cig de nyid du sos par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nas sngags de dang de'i phyag rgyas 'byung po la sogs pas bzung ba dang dug zos pa'i mi gang la rnal 'byor pas reg par byed pa de'i skad cig de nyid du sos par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Then, by that mantra and its seal, the yogin touches the person who is seized by bhūta spirits and so on, or who has eaten poison, and in that very moment he is cured.

original: de bzhin du nam mkha' lding gcig pur bsgrub par byas nas klu la sogs pa thams cad 'grub par 'gyur pa'i pha na yon bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: de bzhin du nam mkha' lding gcig pur bsgrub par byas nas klu la sogs pa thams cad 'grub par 'gyur pa'i pha na yon bstan par mdzad de /
translated: Similarly, having accomplished the garuḍa alone, all the nāgas and so on are accomplished.

original: mkha' lding bsgrubs pas klu rgyal gdengs ka'i bdag po bu bcas g-yog 'khor nyid 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mkha' lding bsgrubs pas klu rgyal gdengs ka'i bdag po bu bcas g-yog 'khor nyid 'gyur ro //
translated: By accomplishing the garuḍa, the nāga kings with their hoods and their children and retinue are subdued.

original: 'byung po gnod sbyin gza' dang mkha' 'gro ma mo sa mchog gnas su ni /
analyzed: 'byung po gnod sbyin gza' dang mkha' 'gro ma mo sa mchog gnas su ni /
translated: In the supreme abode of bhūtas, yakṣas, planets, sky-goers, and mātṛkās,
